header_summary:
The CHECKSIGFROMSTACK workshop hosted by Michael Zaikin on the ctv-csfs-activation IRC channel aimed at discussing the Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) and its use cases, marking a collaborative effort within the Bitcoin developer community. The session's outcomes and discussions were documented for broader access, with a follow-up workshop announced to explore the creation of pools using CTV and CSFS technologies, demonstrating an ongoing commitment to Bitcoin development. [Workshop details and logs](https://ctv-csfs-workshops.github.io/bip348/logs).

The release of Bitcoin Core version 29.1 introduces significant updates including bug fixes, performance enhancements, and a limit on legacy signature operations to prepare for potential future deployments. This version, which supports a broad range of operating systems, represents a collective effort by numerous contributors to enhance Bitcoin's functionality, security, and user experience, urging the community towards upgrading for improved stability and performance. [Read more about the release](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/bitcoin-core-v29-1-released/1978).

A comprehensive cryptography workbook developed for a workshop on Bitcoin cryptography has been made available, covering critical topics from introductory concepts to advanced cryptographic signatures. This resource, designed through participant feedback and extensive testing, aims to deepen understanding of Bitcoin cryptography, emphasizing the practical application and theoretical underpinnings necessary for engaging with state-of-the-art cryptographic research. [Access the workbook](https://github.com/cryptography-camp/workbook/releases).

FernandoTheKoala's discussion on utilizing blockchain technology for the visualization of JPEG images via `op_return` operation reveals that the proposed method might not simplify the process as previously anticipated. This clarification suggests that the current methodology for embedding and visualizing images on the blockchain remains efficient, maintaining the status quo in terms of operational complexity for handling visual data. [Further details on the discussion](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/a-comprehensive-op-return-limits-q-a-resource-to-combat-misinformation/1689/4).

recent_posts.title: IRC logs: BIP 348 Workshop
recent_posts.summary:
- Michael Zaikin led a CHECKSIGFROMSTACK workshop for Bitcoin developers on Libera's IRC.
- The session covered Bitcoin Improvement Proposal discussions, use cases, and transaction creation.
- A future workshop on 18 September 2025 will focus on creating pools with CTV and CSFS.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core v29.1 Released
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 29.1 introduces bug fixes, performance enhancements, and updated translations.
- It includes a mempool policy change and various modifications for improved transaction efficiency.
- Efforts to enhance wallet and P2P functionalities, alongside infrastructure and documentation updates, are notable.

recent_posts.title: Provable Cryptography for Bitcoin: An Introduction (Workbook)
recent_posts.summary:
- The workbook, designed for a Bitcoin cryptography workshop, is extensively refined with participant feedback.
- It covers topics from basic algorithms to advanced cryptographic signatures and security proofs.
- The material includes a preliminary proof for the Schnorr sign-to-contract scheme, emphasizing hands-on learning and research advancement.

recent_posts.title: A Comprehensive OP_RETURN Limits Q&A Resource to Combat Misinformation
recent_posts.summary:
- The discussion explores improving JPEG image visualization via blockchain technology.
- A method embeds images in blockchain using `op_return`, which holds up to 100KB data.
- Proposed `op_return` enhancements might not simplify the visualization process as expected.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Add BIP-0093 (Codex32) as application to BIP-0085
active_posts.summary:
- Ben Westgate suggests integrating BIP-0093 with BIP-0085 to improve wallet backup methods.
- The proposal emphasizes using BIP-0085 for codex32 backups, enhancing error correction and secret sharing.
- Despite codex32's limited wallet adoption, a draft PR for Bitcoin Core indicates growing support.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] OP_TWEAKADD
active_posts.summary:
- Jeremy proposes new Bitcoin opcode, OP_TWEAKADD, for scripting enhancements.
- The design focuses on push semantics, argument order, and simple tweak application.
- Feedback from the Bitcoin development community is encouraged for refinement.

active_posts.title: BIP Booby Trapped Wallets - Covenant-Only Taproot Outputs
active_posts.summary:
- Matias Monteagudo's proposal aims to secure Bitcoin wallets via covenant-only Taproot outputs.
- It introduces a security mechanism for institutional Bitcoin, enforcing script-path spending over key-path.
- The proposal includes detailed specifications, backward compatibility, and addresses economic and security considerations.

active_posts.title: Who will run the CoinJoin coordinators?
active_posts.summary:
- Recent crackdowns have led to the closure of Samourai and Wasabi Wallet's privacy services.
- Alternatives like JoinMarket and the BTCPay Server CoinJoin plugin are gaining traction.
- The author has launched their own BTCPay coordinator service to enhance Bitcoin privacy.

active_posts.title: Sharing block templates
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin nodes and miners have adopted changes like full replace-by-fee and enhanced spam filters.
- Compact block relay, since 2016, has drastically reduced block propagation times, improving network efficiency.
- Alternative solutions, like weak blocks and template sharing, aim to enhance network robustness and efficiency.

active_posts.title: SwiftSync -- Speeding up IBD with pre-generated hints (PoC)
active_posts.summary:
- The write-up on SwiftSync provides an in-depth analysis of its implementation and efficiency improvements.
- It discusses `assumevalid`'s role in speeding up validation by bypassing verification for known-valid blocks.
- The document explores techniques for maintaining system integrity, like safeguarding against inflation and ensuring transaction order.

today_in_history_posts.title: SLIP-0039: Shamir's Secret-Sharing for Mnemonic Codes
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The TREZOR team is developing a new method to divide BIP-32 seeds into several mnemonics.
- They seek feedback on their high-level design, especially on "Master secret derivation functions." - Feedback is encouraged on their ongoing work, detailed in the Design Rationale section.

today_in_history_posts.title: Both-side funded channels
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Cezary discussed implementing both-side funding channels with Christian Decker.
- The plan allows a trustless transaction with mutual funds in the channel.
- Cezary requested clarification and the implementation timeline.

today_in_history_posts.title: Covenant tools softfork
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposed softfork activates BIP-118, BIP-119, and BIP-345, enhancing Bitcoin's functionality.
- BIP-345's deployment is feasible and rapidly implementable, indicating a strong focus on Bitcoin vaults.
- The softfork, involving around 7,000 lines of code, awaits community feedback for further progress.
